page.title: 10WEST HILL FARM, GRETTON
page.content:
West Hill farm is situated on the road from Gretton to Corby. It is farmed by Mr.V.Clark, by whose family it has been farmed for 100 years. It covers an area of 400 acres, one third of which is owned by Mr. Clark and two thirds rented. The farm lies in the parishes of Gretton and Harringworth. The size of each field averages 15 acres with medium to heavy soil. Wheat, oats and barley are the main crops grown.
Mr.Clark owns 50 milking cows, 120 followers, 2 bulls and 200 sheep. The cows are milked twice a day by machine.
Machinery used includes 4 tractors, 2 bailers and 1 combined harvester.
